summary.text:
**Setting up Android SDK**

Iâ€™m looking into setting up the Android SDK and realized we might not need JNI libs or the NDK for this branch. So, Iâ€™ll focus on Android SDK platform 33 and compatible build-tools working with AGP 8.9. 

Weâ€™ll need to create a directory for `.android-sdk` and download the command line tools zip from Google. Iâ€™ll point to the latest version, but I'll keep in mind that version numbers may change; I could also try older versions if necessary. Using `sdkmanager` requires Java, plus ensuring we have the cmdline-tools package is essential.

name: shell
arguments:
{"command":["bash","-lc","set -euo pipefail
SDK_DIR="$PWD/.android-sdk"
mkdir -p "$SDK_DIR"
cd "$SDK_DIR"
ZIP="commandlinetools-mac_latest.zip"
URL="https://dl.google.com/android/repository/commandlinetools-mac-11076708_latest.zip"
echo "Downloading Android command-line tools from $URL"
curl -L -o "$ZIP" "$URL"
ls -lh "$ZIP"
mkdir -p cmdline-tools
unzip -q -o "$ZIP" -d cmdline-tools
# Some zips unpack to a 'cmdline-tools' directory; others unpack 'tools'. Normalize to cmdline-tools/latest
if [ -d cmdline-tools/cmdline-tools ]; then
  mv cmdline-tools/cmdline-tools cmdline-tools/latest || true
elif [ -d cmdline-tools/tools ]; then
  mv cmdline-tools/tools cmdline-tools/latest || true
fi
mkdir -p licenses
printf "8933bad161af4178b1185d1a37fbf41ea5269c55" > licenses/android-sdk-license
find . -maxdepth 2 -type d -print"],"timeout_ms":600000,"with_escalated_permissions":true,"justification":"Download Android SDK command-line tools to a local folder to install required platform packages without system-wide changes."}

summary.text:
**Installing SDK components**

Iâ€™ve extracted the CLI tools to cmdline-tools/latest. Now itâ€™s time to run sdkmanager to install the platform-tools and the specific platforms like android-33, along with build-tools; 33.0.2. The sdkmanager binary is located at cmdline-tools/latest/bin/sdkmanager. Iâ€™ll go ahead and run it to install everything. I need to be aware that I might have to accept licenses, even though we created a license file; sdkmanager might still prompt us. I'll set it to automatically accept with â€œyes | sdkmanager.â€

summary.text:
**Considering app limitations**
